plugins.name: Keyboard Doodler
plugins.description:
With Keyboard Doodler, you can draw with your keyboard!


Why would I want this? You may ask. Drawing the trackpad is overrated! All the cool kids these days draw with the keyboard!


This plugin turns your keyboard into a canvas. By simply pressing keys, vector nodes in that key's location appear on the frame. Try it out and see what drawings you can create!


Tips:


1. Keyboard Doodler connects the vector points you draw. To end the current vector, press return (↵).


2. Your drawings are based on the keys' location in the generated keyboard frame. You can rearrange the keys on the generated keyboard to match your keyboard's layout.


----


Developed by Amanda Yeh and Josh Shi | Github Repo

plugins.name: Variables manager: reorder and copy variables between files
plugins.description:
Master Figma Variables with Variables Manager


Variables Manager is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your design workflow. With our user-friendly interface and robust features, managing design variables has never been easier. Whether you're looking to copy variables to another file in Figma or reorder your variable collections for better efficiency, Variables Manager has you covered.


Key Features of Variables Manager:


- Effortlessly Copy Variables: Transfer variables seamlessly from one Figma file to another, ensuring a consistent design language across all your projects.

- Comprehensive Variable Management: Update, restore, and export variable collections with ease. Keep your design variables organised and accessible.

- Streamlined Variable Integration: Paste your saved variables into new files to kickstart your projects without starting from scratch.

- Reusable Variable Collections: Save time by reusing variables across different projects, maintaining design consistency effortlessly.

- Alias Handling: Manage variable aliases with ease, allowing for more flexible and powerful design systems.


How to Copy Variables to Another File in Figma:

To transfer variables between files effortlessly, follow these simple steps:

1. Open the plugin

2. Click on save new in the top action bar

3. Select the variables you want to move

4. Click on the copy icon to copy the newly created collection backup

5. Navigate to your target file and paste the variables with the clipboard icon at the top action bar


How to Reorder Variables modes in Figma:

Organise your variables modes to match your workflow:

1. Open Variables Manager plugin.

2. Use the 'Reorder variables' function located in the top action bar.

3. Drag & drop your variables into the desired order.

4. Apply the new order with a single click.

5. Enjoy a neatly organized variable collection that aligns with your design process.


How to Restore Prototype Interactions:

Preserve the integrity of your prototype interactions when moving between files:

1. Copy and paste your frame with its prototype interactions into the new file.

2. Open Variables Manager and navigate to the beta section.

3. Select the pasted elements.

4. Use the 'Restore prototype variables' feature to reapply the interactions.



1-min tutorial:

  1. Copy and move variables to another file (Recommended - 4mins)
  2. Copy and share collections with clients, colleagues & more
  3. Reorder Variable modes on Figma
  4. Copy prototype & interactions variables to another file in Figma



Start your next Figma project with confidence, knowing that Variables Manager is here to make variable management a breeze.


We're Here to Help

Got questions or suggestions? Reach out to us with your thoughts or get assistance at contact@figgy.fr – We love hearing from our users!


Found Variables Manager helpful? Support us by liking the plugin and sharing it with fellow designers!


More details about this plugin


Made by stephane with ❤️


Variables Manager is a premium Figma plugin with a limit of 2 collections saved & 10 variables.

Unlock Variables Manager Pro for a one-time payment of €20 per user.
plugins.tagline: Save, copy, and reorder variables across files easily

plugins.name: Fast Chart
plugins.description:
🎉Fast Chart——配置化图表工具


Fast Chart是一款旨在协助设计师和开发者实现图表的提效工具，注释区代码可用于Echarts、AntDesignCharts（桌面端）或AntV/F2（移动端）中图表的实现，从而使图表的设计与调整不再耗时费力


可快速配置想要的桌面端/移动端图表类型，其中类型包含：

  • 折线图（Line charts）：含单折线图、多折线图、迷你折线图
  • 柱状图（Histograms）：含单色柱状图、多色柱状图、分组柱状图、堆叠柱状图、迷你柱状图
  • 条形图（Bar charts）：含单色条形图、多色条形图、分组条形图、堆叠条形图
  • 面积图（Area charts）：含基础面积图、堆叠面积图
  • 散点图（Scatter Charts）：含气泡散点图、矩阵散点图
  • 特殊图表如折柱混合图、地图、漏斗图、雷达图、饼图/环形图


除各图表专属配置项外，其他通用调整项有：数据回填（插件生成的对象）、尺寸调整、标签、轴名称、图例等属性配置（更多图表类型与配置内容将在后期补全），并支持保存模板&使用模板一键回填


欢迎各位同学使用并提出宝贵建议～
plugins.tagline: 配置化图表工具

plugins.name: Safely Delete Components
plugins.description:
When you delete a component, it can be still used in your mockups. On the other hand, unused components clutter up your document.

Safely Delete Components does two things:

🗑  Safe Delete

1. Select a component you want to delete
2. Go to Plugins > Safely Delete Components > Safe Delete (or ⌘+/ > "Safe Delete")
3. This component will be deleted if there are no instances of it in the document

🧹  Delete Unused Components

1. Go to Plugins > Safely Delete Components > Delete Unused Components (or ⌘+/ > "Delete Unused Components")
2. The plugin will find components with no instances and delete them

When the plugin finishes its work, you'll see which components have been deleted.

Be aware that this plugin can be very slow with large documents, especially when working with unused components.

plugins.name: PDF Export with TEXT and VECTOR objects
plugins.description:
MKitFPdf allows you to easily export all or selected frames as PDF, You can edit the order before exporting.

The output differs from others mainly in that all texts as selectable and copyable text taken into the PDF.

Thus, the size of the generated PDF can be greatly minimized.

The generation takes place completely on your end device, none of your data is transferred to an external server, thus your data remains with you.


We had to stop the free use of the plugin.

Two versions are now available:


Free version: contains 5 PDF exports per month.

Paid version: Unlimited PDF export for 1, 6 or 12 months


 Features

  1. Text is exported as TEXT
  2. Vector Objects as Path
  3. Support Layout Grids
  4. Support for owner fonts
  5. add Figma comments to the PDF
  6. Minimum size of the generated pdf
  7. Your data remains with you
  8. Allows you to output tables of contents (Outlines) in pdf format
  9. Allows the specification of PDF boxes (Trimbox, BleedBox,Mediabox)
  10. Allows the specification of meta data such as Title, Author ...


Current restrictions:

  1. No effects like "drop shadow" are supported


Request a feature, report a defect or troubleshoot

For any bug reports and support, please look at our issue tracker
plugins.tagline: Text and vector objects are retained, compresses the file size. Search engines can read the text!

plugins.name: Convert Figma Design to HTML/CSS
plugins.description:
☕ This plugin is free to use.

If it has helped you in your work and you’d like to show your appreciation, feel free to buy me a coffee!



📝 Description

Export Design is an innovative plugin for Figma that allows me to quickly and efficiently convert my Figma projects into HTML and CSS code. Designed with designers and developers in mind, it streamlines the process of moving from design to finished code by eliminating the need for manual coding and reducing the risk of errors.


Test it on the demo file.



🚀 Main features

  1. Seamless Conversion: I can intuitively export selected frames and components from Figma directly to HTML/CSS.
  2. Semantic Class Naming: The plugin automatically generates descriptive and understandable class names, making the code easier to maintain and scale.
  3. Responsive Design: The generated HTML/CSS code is optimized for responsiveness using Flexbox and CSS Grid, ensuring it looks great on all devices.
  4. CSS Optimization: It minimizes redundant styles and uses CSS variables for consistent management of colors and fonts.
  5. Image Exporting: Images are automatically exported in optimized formats (PNG/SVG) and integrated directly into the generated HTML.
  6. Google Fonts Integration: The plugin automatically adds links to Google Fonts based on the fonts used in my design, ensuring typography consistency.


ℹ️ How to Use the Plugin

  1. Select a Frame - Choose the frame or component you want to export to HTML/CSS.
  2. Generate the Code - Click the “Export” button in the plugin interface to start the conversion process.
  3. Export to HTML/CSS - Click the “Export HTML” and Export CSS buttons in the plugin interface to export files.
  4. Download images - Click Downloand to save your images and svg file in /images


💡 Tips

Adding Tags HTML

To specify a semantic HTML tag for an element, include the appropriate tag in the element’s name, such as <button>, <h1>, <h2>. The plugin will use these tags when generating the HTML code.


Example

"<button> CTA"
"<h1> Hello World "



🔧 Future Updates

Export Design is currently in its second version and will be regularly updated with new features and improvements. I encourage you to test the plugin and share your feedback to help us continue developing this tool.


⚠️ Warrning

The generated files are not intended for production use. They are designed to accelerate your workflow and serve as a starting point for further modifications.

accepted.name: Lukasz Kokosinski
accepted.description: Design System Specialist / Product Owner / UX/UI Designer / Branding.

plugins.tagline: Free and simple plugin to export Figma designs to the web [HTML, CSS, Assets, Fonts]

plugins.name: axe for Designers: A Free Accessibility Plugin
plugins.description:
axe for Designers: A Free Accessibility Plugin


Are you exhausted from dealing with endless back and forth with developers, messy handouts, and accessibility issues in your designs? Introducing axe for Designers, a Figma accessibility plugin supported by AI/ML, developed by Deque, a market leader in digital accessibility.


With features like A11y Scan (previously auto scan), wcag Color Contrast Checker, Focus Order, Annotations, and more, you can quickly and easily identify any accessibility issues before your design goes into production. And if you're already in the middle of a project, our tool can help you analyze and fix accessibility issues that have cropped up.


Best of all, you can use our Figma accessibility plugin for free!!


Introducing axe for Designers' features

Ensure your designs meet WCAG compliance standards with a single click. plugins.name: Roller · Design Linter
plugins.description:
Roller is the first ever Design Linter - giving you the power to automatically find and fix style inconsistencies in your files. Be confident every design you hand-off is 100% consistent with your Style Guide or Design System.

 

How to use Roller:

1 - Import or add your styles to the Roller Library

2 - Roller then automatically finds any inconsistencies (Errors) on the page that don’t match what is in your Library

3 - Replace the Error with one of your Library’s styles

4 - Rinse & repeat to reach 100% consistency

 

Lint in the following categories:

• Colors - Quickly fix the 50 (or 5,000) shades of gray that are lurking in your designs.

 

• Text - If a subtle line-height or letter-spacing is off, Roller will pick them up and get you back on system.

 

• Borders - Roller lets you add the width and colors of your borders - making it easy to find any rogue input field or card.

 

• Shadows - Roller gives you superhuman eyes - making it possible to detect subtle differences in shadow blurs or x, y offsets.

 

• Radiuses - Be confident that any button, card, input etc. has the correct border-radiuses applied.

 

Keep your team in-sync:

Roller lets you store and share your Library with teammates. Make sure everyone on your team has up-to-date resources and styles when linting.

plugins.name: Sizze - Figma to Native powered by AI
plugins.description:
Our Figma plugin effortlessly bridges the gap between design and development by transforming your Figma designs into ready-to-use components within the Sizze library. This tool is designed to streamline workflows and enhance productivity for both designers and developers, offering several key features:


- Functional and Visual Adaptability: It ensures that the components are both visually appealing and functionally robust, allowing for a high degree of customization.


- Broad React Compatibility: The plugin supports seamless integration with any React-based application, including React Native, making it versatile for both web and mobile development projects.


- Ionic and Capacitor Integration: For teams working on hybrid mobile applications, the plugin's compatibility with Ionic and Capacitor is a significant advantage.


- Native Design Compliance: It adheres to the design guidelines of iOS and Android, ensuring that the apps maintain a native look and feel on both platforms.


- Customizable Themes: With support for global styles for dark and light themes, the plugin allows for easy theme customization across projects or specific components.


This Figma plugin is an essential tool for teams aiming to accelerate their app development process while ensuring consistency and compatibility across platforms.

plugins.name: Typography Style Guide Generator
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to generate a typography style guide based on your defined local styles.

The generator is especially built for teams who work according to the Tailwind Design system and use the associated naming scheme (e.g., "Heading / L / Regular").


Styles will be grouped based on the prefix before the slash and sorted by font size. Relevant font information like family, size, line height, and others will be shown per style. If there is no prefix, then the styles will be added to a group called "Other".


There are three options when running the plugin:

  • Create a style guide with all defined local text styles.
  • Create a style guide with all defined local text styles and add a tag if the style is used on the currently open page. This is especially useful if you have a large design system and thus not all styles are relevant for a subproject, but you still want to show the whole set.
  • Create a style guide with only the used local text styles on the current page.


Enjoy and looking forward to your feedback.

accepted.name: novu
accepted.description: Web and Software Agency from Basel, Bern, and Zurich

plugins.tagline: Automatically generate text style guides based on your defined local text styles.

plugins.name: Accessible color palettes
plugins.description:
This is a tool to generate a dynamic, accessibility-first color palette for your design systems within Figma.


Using key colors, you can target specific contrast ratios against a chosen background color and color space. These constraints will generate a color palette based on that key color. You can choose to test and find out more information, or set the color styles for your file based on these results.


If you'd like a video walkthrough on how I use this tool, you can see that here on my Youtube Channel.


This tool leverages the work done by Nate Baldwin on LeonardoColor.io, an open source color tool, to bring similar functionality into generating test palettes, and updating styles in your system. Thus allowing you to check your work with more data from their tool.


If you have any questions, you can reach out to me on Twitter at @darianrosebrook

accepted.name: Darian Rosebrook
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.name: Above The Fold
plugins.description:
Make sure your most important elements will be visible every time on every device. Above the Fold plugin marks your designs with a layer that indicates where the above-the-fold portion ends.


🔌How Above the Fold plugin works?


- Select one (or more) Artboard(s).

- Run the plugin with your desired target device.

- Your results * are ready


* The results are seperate layers on top of each Artboard.


❓ How can Above the Fold help me?


Above the Fold is the portion of a Web page that is visible in a browser window when the page first loads. Users engage more with the content above the fold than below the fold, thus key site functions and content related to business goals should appear at the top of the Web page.


🚨 What is the Danger zone?


The viewport is the area where browsers load the web pages and >90% * is different than the user's screen resolution. The browser and OS navigation bars add a dynamic offset to the final viewport. The danger zone represent the average difference in height between screen resolution and viewport.


*They are equal only when the web browser is in fullscreen mode

plugins.name: Text Styles Creator
plugins.description:
Text Style Creator is a handy Figma plugin that automates the process of creating text styles from your text layers.


Usage:

  1. Select your text layer(s).
  2. Run the plugin.


The plugin will create a new text style for each unique set of text properties.


Features:


  • Creates new text styles based on the properties of your selected text layers and immediately applies them.
  • Avoids duplicating styles with the same properties, even across different text contents.
  • Notifies you if no layers are selected, how many new styles have been created, how many existing styles were skipped, and applies the created styles to the selected text.


Feature Updates:


  • Bulk Selection Support: Enhanced to support bulk selection, ensuring when multiple text layers with the same properties are selected, only one unique style is created, reducing redundancy and clutter.
  • Automatic Style Application: Added functionality to automatically apply the created text style to the selected text layers, streamlining your workflow.
  • Efficient Style Management: Continues to prevent the creation of new styles for layers that already match an existing style, maintaining a tidy style library.


Please note:

This plugin only works with text layers and uses the text content as the style name. It's designed to be a simple, run-once tool to help streamline your design workflow in Figma.


Kishor on Dribbble and Instagram


Please give Text Style Creator a try and see if it suits your needs. Looking forward to your valuable feedback!
plugins.tagline: Automate text style creation and management in Figma for a smoother design workflow.

plugins.name: Smartcat Translator
plugins.description:
Go to market faster by enhancing collaboration among Product, Design, and Localization teams with the Smartcat Figma plugin.


Use Cases


  1. Asset translation: Translate any marketing resources, banners, social media posts, e-learning materials, blog posts, static pages, documents, and any visuals.
  2. Software localization: Seamlessly integrate design and localization processes with your CI/CD pipelines for mobile apps and software. Development teams download and integrate translated files from Smartcat into their codebase.


Live Preview for Precision


Live Previews let translators see their work in the Figma design immediately, ensuring it fits perfectly.

  1. Shorter time to market: Minimize translation time by identifying errors and problematic elements before viewing inside Figma.
  2. In-context editing: Translators see the final view of what the translated text and design look like together in Smartcat.
  3. Save on Figma user seat costs: Remove the need to provide Figma seats to translators, editors, or quality assurance managers.


AI+human translation workflows


Combine the best of AI and human ingenuity for unprecedented translation quality.

  1. Configure any workflow, ranging from AI translation only to a more thorough lifecycle, such as configuring AI translation, post-translation review, and QA stages sequentially.
  2. Invite an unlimited number of team members and external collaborators – we don’t charge extra for that.
  3. Choose your translators from 500,000+ professional linguists and agencies on Smartcat Marketplace, or invite your own linguists to your Smartcat workspace.


Smartcat is your complete end-to-end AI translation solution


  1. AI actions: Smartcat Editor is powered by AI to help translators boost their productivity and organizations get higher-quality translations.
  2. Effortless collaboration: Translators and editors can work on a document simultaneously, seeing the full context and communicating in real-time.
  3. Translation memories boost productivity and ensure consistency by storing and reusing translated segments for similar texts, maintaining uniform terminology across projects.
  4. Payment automation: Make the linguist payment process fast and easy with one contract and one invoice for all your suppliers on Smartcat.


Favored by industry leaders


Smartcat is trusted by 1,000+ global companies, including over 20% of the Fortune 500 industry leaders like Volvo, LG, Peloton, eBay, L'Oréal, and Stanley Black & Decker choose Smartcat to efficiently translate and localize all kinds of documents, software, video and audio files, and websites.


Have a question?

Contact us anytime if you need assistance

Learn more about the Smartcat plugin
plugins.tagline: Instantly translate your Figma pages and individual frames into any language with Smartcat!

plugins.name: Ugic AI: Generate UI Based Any Component Library
plugins.description:
What is Ugic？

Ugic, the UI generation tool that creates interfaces from descriptions, will transform your approach to work. It can generate customized AI-driven, multi-language Figma drafts based on user component libraries and design systems. ugic.ai↗️


  1. Customized AI Generation. Aligned with Your Design System
  2. Unlimited Styles. Generated from Your Component Library
  3. Ultimate Efficiency Boost. AI Generation from Lengthy PRDs
  4. Multilingual Generation. PRD Recognition and Draft Generation in Dozens of Languages


Now to embark on the amazing journey with Ugic! Fill out the form for a chance to get an invitation code: https://forms.gle/GwwtDSsyWVAshaedA


👏Read before using - Here's how to use the plugin


How to use the plugin at the fastest speed?

  1. Go to the community to download a component library file. Open the plugin within the component library file.


Don't want to enter the component library file? How to use the plugin in any file?

  1. Access the published team library file.
  2. Open the plugin and navigate to the 'Personal Library'.
  3. Click 'Upload', and once the process is complete, you can use this component library to generate UI within any file as needed.


Got questions？Chat us with Discord


Help Center ↗️ Twitter ↗️

plugins.name: IconCrab - Icon Exporter
plugins.description:
Export / Generate productions ready IconCrab from Figma in seconds.


Features

  • Customizable sizes
  • Resize multiple icons with multiple sizes in Figma
  • Export all selected icons Folder according to their size
  • Export multiple file extensions


To use IconCrab

  1. Install and run the “IconCrab - Icon Exporter” plugin.
  2. Highlight frame(s) in your Figma project to preview your icon(s) on left side as slider.
  3. Choose sizes which you want to. You can customize your special sizes on the right side
  4. Choose file extension(s)
  5. If you want to export icons as a zip file check the file checkbox. If not, only can check Figma.
  6. Click the Export button


License

After you've tried exporting icons with IconCrab 3 times, you'll be asked to enter your license key. Your license key will allow you or your team to export an unlimited amount of favicons using IconCrab.


To purchase a license for you or your team, please visit https://gum.co/iconcrab (Gumroad)

plugins.name: Figma Finder
plugins.description:
Figma Finder is a launcher utility plugin.

It gives you quick access to all your essential things.


- Accessing pages, layers, views, and much quickly

- Browsing your figma’s Layers broad using keywords matching.


🚀Launcher feature


Add Frame:

1. Select a frame you want to save to the launcher

2. Enter a name in the input field at the bottom of the plugin and press the Add button.


Add View

1. Move to the position you want to save to the launcher.

2. Enter a name in the input field at the bottom of the plugin and press the Add button.


🔎Spotlight feature

- Enter a keyword in the search box, and the layers that match the keyword will be listed.

- When you select a search result item, you will be moved to the location of the layer of that item.


Developed with reference to ViewFinder.

Thanks for the great idea @ahmedmigo(Ahmed Genaidy)


💫Feature requests or Questions

Just hit me on Web (https://okazu.co), via mail (hello@okazu.co)

plugins.name: Coda for Figma
plugins.description:
Design with data from apps like Spotify, Wikipedia or your own custom data with this plugin. This plugin works with Coda, a tool for making documents. Simply create a table in Coda, and use the plugin to fill your designs with content from the tables.


→ To use this plugin

1. Create a Coda doc with a table in it, or use the example doc that's provided. The example doc already has data for you to get started with.

2. Fill individual layers by selecting the layer you want to change, and then select the relevant column in the plugin selector.

3. Group layers, or create a component, to keep related info together.

4. Select an entire frame or multiple groups to update all of the layers at once.


→ Live Data

To pull live data into your Figma designs, create a Packs Table in Coda. Using Packs you can pull in data from Wikipedia, Spotify, Intercom and more. Once you've set up your table, you can connect your design to that table and watch it fill up with real data.


→ Custom Data

To pull custom data into your Figma docs, create a Table in Coda. You can enter text, image URLs, formulas, and more. Then, connect your layers to that table, and watch your designs fill up with your own data.


See more info here: https://coda.io/d/Example-data-doc_dFOHtXx4pnz

accepted.name: Helena Jaramillo
accepted.description: Here for softer technology / Design @ Coda.

* you can now populate hyperlinks with data from coda. if a textlayer has a hyperlink, data applied to the layer will replace the url of the hyperlink

plugins.name: ItemFlow
plugins.description:
Visually connect 2 figma elements.

Made with workflow speed and performance in mind.


Purpose

It solves a need to see how items are related to each other by visually connecting them. Original purpose is to design complex systems and their architecture.


Terminology

  • Item - is any figma element (text, frame, group, image)
  • Flow - is a line that goes from item -> to item


How to use

  • Create/Update flow - select the first and the second items by holding shift.
  • Delete flow - set 'lock' switch to disabled state, select flow directly and delete it by pressing [Delete].
  • Get static flow - select flows you need, group them by pressing [Ctrl + G] and move outside the 'ItemFlow' group

Interface guide is in the cover art or on imgur


Technical stuff

The more flows you got, the less frequent plugin will update them in order to save you fps.


There are many plugins like that, why am i copying their ideas?

(UX opinion from september 2021) 

I tried many free plugins to create flows and all of them had great implementations of how it should be, but they also got weak sides to do architecture stuff.


Get the source code and/or contribute Github


Because its free, i feel in power to advertise our group :)

We are designing mmorpg and looking for enthusiasts

plugins.name: Lokalise
plugins.description:
What is Lokalise?


All-in-one localization and translation management platform that allows developers, designers, translators, and product managers to work seamlessly together and deliver digital products into multiple international markets faster and in a more efficient manner.


How does Figma + Lokalise work?


Lokalise enables you to design a product or a website for a global audience right away. Use the Figma plugin to quickly include translated content in your designs without going back and forth with product managers, translators and developers.


This Figma plugin allows you to:


- Push texts from Figma to Lokalise

- Set key names (unique identifiers that are used for representing text in code and your design) or use any of the patterns for automatic naming

- Match Figma texts to existing Lokalise keys (and existing translations)

- Pull translated texts from Lokalise to Figma

- Seamlessly switch languages in Figma and check if your design works in other languages


Launch the plugin


1. Open your Figma project

2. Go to the Plugins section and choose Lokalise

3. Connect your Lokalise account

4. Allow Figma to access your Lokalise workspace.

5. Go back to Figma and select one of the existing Lokalise projects or create a new one. You can also set the default key naming pattern and the default platform for the newly created keys (this applies to the keys this Figma plugin will create in Lokalise).

6. Click Finish Setup.


When the setup is complete. Start using the plugin by pushing your Figma strings to the Lokalise project so translators can start working on them right away.


For more information (with screenshots) check out the detailed documentation page

https://docs.lokalise.com/en/articles/3732824-figma


This plugin requires a paid Lokalise account (14-day free trial).
plugins.tagline: Quickly include translated content in your designs
